de.hpi.javaide.breakout.screens

Class GameScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hpi.javaide.breakout.screens.GameScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Displayable, Initializable, Screen, Updateable

    public class GameScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements Screen
    Diese Klasse repraesentiert die Anzeige des Spielbildschirms.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Lukas Schramm, openHPI

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Screen getInstance(Game game)
        GameScreen implements a "Lazy Instantiation" of the Singleton Design Patterns (Gang of Four) This approach is not "Thread safe", but is sufficient for our current needs. Please, be aware that Singletons need to be handled with care. There are various ways to implement them, all have there pros and cons. In his book, Effective Java, Joshua Bloch recommends to create Singletons using an enum, which is a language concept that we have not discussed here so far. For those of you who want to go further we suggest to follow this recommendation at some point of time.
        Returns:
        the EndScreen
